meanings.definition: To give back or restore (something) to its original state or condition.
meanings.sent1: I will rechange the book to the library tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rechange the broken vase with a new one.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up, he had to rechange the order to the correct one.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to rechange the rabbit into a hat.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to rechange the engine to its former glory.

meanings.definition: To exchange something for something else.
meanings.sent1: Can I rechange this shirt for a different size?
meanings.sent2: They agreed to rechange the gift for a more suitable one.
meanings.sent3: She tried to rechange the toy for a better one, but the store was closed.
meanings.sent4: The siblings decided to rechange their snacks with each other.
meanings.sent5: He wanted to rechange his phone for the latest model.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to rechange the old projector with a new one.
meanings.sent2: They had to rechange the actor due to scheduling conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to rechange the ingredient with a different one.
meanings.sent4: The coach decided to rechange the player for a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: She had to rechange her original plan with a new strategy.
